etymons.meaning: to warm, be warmed; to become warm, hot

translations: ‘He found himself between the sheep and got warm a little bit’

Infectum.turoyo: gəš-šŭḥál-lox 261; qadə́m l-i=nuroišmo d-šəḥal-ləxxrəzlaruḥabəṯreḥaṣe w-ḥəṣlaqəm-ṣadra w-ko-maḥtofemabəṯreqḏole w-k-obo-le náfashawxašaḥino dad-u=zlamšoḥal-le
translations: ‘She squeezed in behind him, clasped him to her breast, then placed her mouth behind his neck and started breathing on him in order for him to get warm’

Preterit.turoyo: mšaḥalle u=məhər 263; prs 22/26; prs 28/17; 78/58; mədla ag=gurw-ayḏi, məḷḷa: “šlaḥ!” šləḥli ag=gurwe w-amṭelamayemaḥatlaʕal-i=ṣopa, mšaḥalla am=maye w-məḷḷa: “mgaliraġlux!” ‘
translations: She took my socks… She said: “Take (them) off!” – I took the socks off, and she brought water and put it on the oven, heated up the water and said: “Uncover your leg!” LB 261;

Infectum.turoyo: bəṯṯərməd-səmmeaš=šəlfkat, ko-motənqarne, w ko-mšaḥnən-ne, w mnaǧrən-ne 263; 94/13; azzéhanoamṭeletaʕno d-salune, maḥtileʕal-u=tarʕo,hatta d-mašəġ-le w-mšaḥalle am=mayeġálabe

Infectum-wa.turoyo: yawmo b-u=yawmo ... gə-mšaḥnó-way-la qarwana d-maye 264; 113/152; ʕal i=tfayogə-mšaḥní-way-na-le hawxačike, hawxačikešoḥən lo=ġắlabe

Imperativ.turoyo: šaḥǝ́nhanoaqim-e w itóxḥet-e harke, gən-noyəḥ 264; prs 29/6; prs 53/2; zoxutawuṣəfriye d-maye, šaḥénul-la

Preterit.turoyo: hiyemašḥalleqarʕe d-i=səsto; bə-ḥḏo=barmeḥḏo, qṭileaḥ=ḥamšo 263; 78/109; kalino b-tarʕo d-bayto, ḥḏobarṯoaṯyo, manḥátla-li w-mašḥánla-li
translations: ‘I stopped by the door of a house, and a girl came outside, pulled me down (from the horse) and warmed me’
